bibl.title: Despatch from R. Dorsey Mohew to W.F. Wharton, November 10, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.ab:
Commercial Agency, U.S.A. Boma, Confogo Free State Jany 27th, 1889
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your despatch No. 1 dated January 22nd, and beg to say that I accept the appoint- ment as Commercial Agent of the United States at Boma in the Congo Free State.
I enclose herewith Bond and pack of office duty executed

I am, Sir Very respectfully R. Dorsey Mohew Commercial Agent Congo Free State
P. I was was born in the Dostuch of Columbia and was appointed from the same place. R. Dorsey Mohew
